meanings.definition: Misparting (verb): to divide or separate incorrectly
meanings.sent1: She kept misparting the puzzle pieces, making it hard to complete.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students about misparting their group project tasks.
meanings.sent3: The chef's misparting of the ingredients turned the cake into a savory disaster.
meanings.sent4: His misparting of the truth created a rift between friends.
meanings.sent5: The misparting of the road sign led to confusion among drivers.

meanings.definition: Misparting (noun): an incorrect division or separation
meanings.sent1: The misparting of the cake layers resulted in a lopsided dessert.
meanings.sent2: The misparting of responsibilities caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent3: The misparting of the teams made for an interesting game.
meanings.sent4: The misparting of the book chapters confused the readers.
meanings.sent5: The misparting of the colors in the painting gave it a unique charm.

meanings.definition: Misparting (adjective): describing something that has been divided or separated incorrectly
meanings.sent1: The misparting lines on the map led them astray.
meanings.sent2: The misparting sections of the document caused misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: His misparting haircut made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The misparting walls in the house gave it a quirky layout.
meanings.sent5: The misparting colors on the flag made it hard to recognize.
